title: Form guide: Ben Youngs to make history for England in crucial World Cup clash against Argentina
text:
A victory against Argentina in Tokyo will take England a long way towards winning Pool C and reaching the World Cup quarter-finals.

Scrum-half Ben Youngs will make his 92nd England appearance, overtaking Jonny Wilkinson's record for back, while George Ford and Owen Farrell will form a twin playmaking axis once again.

Sportsmail's NIK SIMON has the run-down of England's starting XV for the decisive clash in Tokyo.

At scrum-half, Ben Youngs is earning a record 92nd cap for England against Argentina

FULL BACK: 15. Elliot Daly AGE: 26 CAPS: 35

Starts 18th consecutive Test. His deft kicking game has been effective in transition play from defence to attack.

WING: 14. Anthony Watson AGE: 25 CAPS: 38

Shown flashes of brilliance in attack as he searches for 2017 Lions form after long injury setback.

CENTRE: 13. Manu Tuilagi AGE: 28 CAPS: 36

Delivered one of the standout performances of the World Cup so far as a one-man wrecking ball against Tonga.

Manu Tuilagi will be looking to replicate his rampaging performance against Tonga for England

CENTRE: 12. Owen Farrell (C) AGE: 28 CAPS: 75

Second kicking option could be key in attack as defences are rushing up to try to force drops in humid conditions.

WING: 11. Jonny May AGE: 29 CAPS: 48

Speedy cover defence could be important against a side who love to attack from deep in broken play.

FLY-HALF: 10. George Ford AGE: 26 CAPS: 61

Rediscovered his confidence in the No 10 shirt and can trouble the Pumas with clever passes at the gainline.

Since regaining the No 10 jersey for England, George Ford has looked back to his best form

SCRUM-HALF: 9. Ben Youngs AGE: 30 CAPS: 91

Overtakes Jonny Wilkinson as England's most-capped back but must improve on tempo from previous start.

NUMBER EIGHT: 8. Billy Vunipola AGE: 26 CAPS: 47

His Tongan countrymen broke through Argentina's 10-12 channel seven times last week so the giant No 8 will look to follow suit.

OPENSIDE FLANKER: 7. Sam Underhill AGE: 23 CAPS: 11

Almost two stone lighter than his opposite man but could run Pumas off their feet at the breakdown.

BLINDSIDE FLANKER 6. Tom Curry AGE: 21 CAPS: 15

Adapting to No 6 jersey by studying videos of Australia's David Pocock during one-to-one sessions with World Cup winner Richard Hill.

Tom Curry is adapting well to his new position at blindside flanker during the World Cup

SECOND ROW: 5. George Kruis AGE: 29 CAPS: 37

Needs to combat Pumas' line-out which provided platform for three tries against Tonga last week.

SECOND ROW: 4. Maro Itoje AGE: 24 CAPS: 30

Reunited with Saracens partner George Kruis for the first time in Japan. Superior dynamism and athletic ability could be key.

PROP: 3. Kyle Sinckler AGE: 26 CAPS: 27

Warned the Pumas that England want to bring out their scrum and maul 'tank' in the opening 30 minutes of the contest.

HOOKER: 2. Jamie George AGE: 28 CAPS: 41

Using 'cricket' trigger-words to perfect lineout throwing — holding his position after releasing the ball, like a cover drive.

PROP: 1. Joe Marler AGE: 29 CAPS: 64

Showed his softer side in an 'owl cafe' this week but has re-established himself as a fierce international scrummager.

After reversing his international retirement, Joe Marler has established himself in the front row

SUBSTITUTES: Luke Cowan-Dickie, Mako Vunipola, Dan Cole, Courtney Lawes, Lewis Ludlam, Willi Heinz, Henry Slade, Jack Nowell.

ARGENTINA

Boffelli; Moroni, Orlando, De La Fuente, Carreras; Urdapilleta, Cubelli; Chaparro, Montoya, Figallo; Pagadizabal, Lavanini; Matera, Kremer, Desio.

SUBSTITUTES: Creevy, Vivas, Medrano, Alemanno, Lezana, Ezcurra, Mensa, Delguy.

authors: Nik Simon For The Daily Mail
